fields.job_description:
We are looking for an Ambitious, Commercial and Experienced Designer Women's Accessories Buyer  ready for a new challenge with Luxe Avenue's Accessories Buying Department.

The Designer Buyer will be an inspiring market leader who will deliver on our commitment to reinventing retail and achieve an experience and offering that excites and enhances our customer’s lives.

As a curious individual and critical thinker, you will look beyond the obvious to identify opportunities and make sound decisions and strategic moves for the business. You will bring a leading edge to the Women's Accessories Designer category curating an offering of the most exclusive international brands for Luxe Avenue.

This is an opportunity for an experienced Buyer who has a genuine passion for luxury designer brands to join a talented and inspiring Buying team.
fields.key_requirements:
Will be a passionate Buyer operating at this level with extensive experience in the Designer arena.

You will be a forward thinker, be ahead of seasonal trends and have the ability to curate the very best Designer collections for the Luxe Avenue  customer.

You will have strong leadership skills and an ability to inspire Buying teams

You will be commercially focused, have experience with budgets and a proven ability to achieve commercial targets.

You will work with the Fashion Buying Director to develop and implement a solid commercial and creative strategy for the area.

Responsible for buying decisions based on a sound commercial framework to drive sales and profit.

You will be aware of trends in public opinion, taste and understand their implications for the business. Applying your knowledge of Designer Brands, you will lead the sourcing of our products – keeping us one-step ahead of our competitors.

Responsible for range planning, working closely with the Fashion Buying Director and Buying Manager, to be accountable for the movement of stock from vendor to supply change and store.

You will manage existing brands through analysis of performance, taking action when necessary and making decisions to keep or discontinue within the business.

fields.job_description:
At Luxe Avenue we exist to imagine and create a sustainable future for our people, customers and communities. Our values:  do the right thing, go above and beyond and drive creativity and innovation remain at the heart of everything we do. We are reinventing retail and the way we work to enable our teams to be more agile, flexible and responsive to our customer’s needs.

The Role:

Prepare for and assist in the process of stocktaking.
Complete stock on hand audit checks for each brand within your department daily / weekly. 
Ensure all stock on hand discrepancies are highlighted to management and stock audit.
Any stock discrepancies to be investigated thoroughly and stock amendments / adjustments completed and communicated to management and stock audit.
Monitor stock movement  in and out for shoots and shows and events. 
Review and update customer holds in line with the company policy.  
Support with the completion and process of stock returning to vendors, transfers and damaged stock.
To achieve daily / weekly targets.
fields.key_requirements: Will have stockroom or stock handling experience.  Will have previously worked in a fast paced environment. Be an effective communicator. Have exceptional organisation skills. Be self-motivated.

fields.name: Michelle Johnson
fields.bio: Michelle Johnson is our Buying Director. She leads the buying for Luxe Avenue across the region and she created our merchandising strategy. Previously she has worked as Buying Manager for Jone Lacey's .

fields.name: Lauren Wilcox
fields.bio: Lauren Wilcox is Commercial Manager for our luxury brands and e-commerce retail market. She is responsible for growing our portfolio of customers, pursuing new business opportunities and leading our sales and marketing strategies.  She keeps track of the latest trends and developments and represents Luxe Avenue at industry events.

fields.name: John Boyce
fields.bio: John Boyce is our Dublin Store Manager. He has vast experience in high-end retail management.  Before joining our team he worked for Brooke Wallace.
